feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Title:"Document Identification When Combining Multiple Standard Reports (SD/MM/FI)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question regarding document identification when combining multiple standard reports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
Due to limitations on creating custom reports in Public Edition, we are considering outputting multiple standard reports and linking them by key fields to create a combined document.

Questions:

1. Document numbers can overlap across SD/MM/FI modules. How should we identify documents uniquely?

Example:
- SD Sales Document Number: 1234567890
- MM Purchasing Document Number: 1234567890
- FI Accounting Document Number: 1234567890

2. What combination of fields is required to uniquely identify a document?
- Is Document Number + Document Type sufficient?
- Are Company Code, Fiscal Year, and Organization (Sales Org/Purchasing Org) also required?

3. When linking reports from different modules (e.g., SD report and FI report), what common key fields should be used?
Do we need to use reference document number fields?

4. Are there limitations on which key fields can be output in standard reports?
Are there cases where necessary identification fields cannot be output in certain reports?

I would appreciate any insights from actual implementation experience or best practices.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to Track Offsetting Accounts Through Interim Accounts (e.g., Payables ‚Üí GR/IR ‚Üí Inventory) in S/
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question about tracking offsetting accounts through interim accounts in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Scenario:
In the procurement process with GR/IR clearing account, the accounting flow is:

1. Goods Receipt:
DR: Inventory 100
CR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100

2. Invoice Receipt:
DR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100
CR: Accounts Payable 100

Question:
When reviewing Accounts Payable line items, the offsetting account shows "GR/IR Clearing Account." However, we need to trace back to the original offsetting account (Inventory) that was posted when the goods were received.

In other words: Accounts Payable ‚Üí GR/IR ‚Üí **Inventory**

Is there a standard way in Public Edition to:
1. Display this multi-level offsetting account relationship in a single report?
2. Download a list showing the complete flow (AP ‚Üí GR/IR ‚Üí Inventory)?
3. Automatically link the invoice document to the original goods receipt accounting document?

Current Understanding:
- FI documents only show direct offsetting accounts (1-to-1 relationship)
- Standard reports like "Display Journal Entries" show GR/IR details but don't automatically link to the original inventory posting

Questions:
1. Is there a standard Fiori app or report that can trace through interim accounts?
2. Does the "Manage GR/IR Clearing Account" app (if available) provide this functionality?
3. Would we need to use custom queries via BTP/SAC to achieve this?
4. Are there any best practices for this requirement in Public Edition?

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Can We Download App ID, Reference Information, and Object Text with Journal Entries/G/L Account Line
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We have a question about downloadable fields when exporting journal entries and G/L account line items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
We operate with multiple company codes and plants, and need to track:
- Which app was used to post each document
- Whether posting was manual or automatic
- Reference/source information

Questions:

When downloading data from standard apps like:
- Display Journal Entries
- Display G/L Account Line Items

Can we include the following fields in the download?

1. **App ID (Transaction Code equivalent)**
- Which Fiori app was used to create the document
- Example: F0717 (Post General Journal Entries), F1814 (Enter Supplier Invoice)
- Or at minimum: Document Type (SA, KR, DR, etc.)

2. **Reference Processing Information**
- Reference Document Number
- Original Document Number
- Purchase Order Number (for MM documents)
- Sales Order Number (for SD documents)
- Any indicator of manual vs. automatic posting

3. **Object Text**
- Document Header Text
- Line Item Text
- Cost Center Text / WBS Text
- (Clarification: We're also not 100% sure what "Object Text" refers to - any insights?)

Current Understanding:
- App ID is likely NOT stored in FI documents
- Reference document numbers might be available
- Various text fields should be available as selection options

Questions:
1. Which of these fields are actually available in standard journal/G/L reports?
2. Can they be added as columns in the download/export?
3. Are there alternative apps or reports that provide this information?
4. Any workarounds if these fields are not available in standard reports?

We're trying to avoid custom development if possible and want to use standard functionality.

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Where is item that Payment Terms in JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In?
entry.content:
Dear All.

We use JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In in this Project.

I thought that payment information(payment terms, payment method, DueCalculationBaseDate, etc.) is derived by supplier master, but, this is not correct.
Because, As far as I can tell, the payment method was blank and the DueCalculationBaseDate was today.

If there is a way to derive payment information from the vendor, please let me know.
If not, I would like to ask how to enter the payment information.  Is the only option that entry directly to item of payment method, etc.

Best Regards,

entry.title: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods?
entry.content:
How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods when the wrong period is selected during a depreciation job?

For example, if the job for September has been completed and then the job for November was run directly.

entry.title: Timeouts When Maintaining Large Business Roles in S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL ‚Äì CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

In our S/4HANA Public Cloud 3SL (CBC) Development and Test tenants, we are experiencing persistent issues when maintaining a large business role that includes all available business catalogs (currently more than 1,400).

Whenever we try to update an existing super-user role that already contains approximately 1,000 catalogs, or when we attempt to create a new role containing all catalogs through the ‚ÄúMaintain Business Roles‚Äù Fiori app, we receive TimeOut or RunTime errors.

We use this wide-access role for key users to quickly determine whether issues raised by stakeholders‚Äîsuch as after activating new scope items or after upgrades‚Äîare related to missing authorizations.

I would appreciate hearing from anyone who has encountered similar challenges. How did you resolve or work around these performance limitations?

Additionally, is there a way to build such a role using the ‚ÄúCreate From Template‚Äù option instead of manually adding each catalog through the UI? If so, where can the template be found and which fields are required for a successful upload?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Kind regards,
Mike van Ingen

entry.title: Handling RFC Queue Errors in SAP EWM Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In SAP EWM Public Cloud, you can view and reprocess RFC queue errors directly from the Warehouse Monitor. Pending queues are visible there, and you can reprocess them once the underlying issue is resolved.

The real problem starts when the error has no actual fix. For example, an inbound delivery that was already put away, but the logistics period was afterward shifted. This leaves you with an RFC error you cannot resolve, and when you open the queue details there is no option to influence the data container, such as adjusting the posting date. Rejecting the queue does not work either.

Transaction /SCWM/ERP_STOCKCHECK technically exists, but since the queue is still present, you cannot clean up the situation through that check. The only app that seems remotely comparable to transaction SQM2 is F5427 (Manage Queue), yet it does not display anything relevant here.

Question
How can these unresolvable RFC queue errors be corrected in SAP EWM Public Cloud?

Thanks

entry.title: How to set up billing job for the last WD of the month
entry.content: We are on Public Cloud and we use Schedule Billing Creation for Preliminary Billing Documents app to schedule daily jobs. But we would like to set up a recurring job on every last Working Day of a month and I cannot see any option like that. When I choose End of Month there is no way to choose last WD. Only '- some amount of days' but not 0. Any idea how to set it up?

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud ADT Package deleted
entry.content:
Dear All

While working over SAP Public Cloud using Eclipse ADT , we connected it with Git to move the package to another project but due to some unknown reason instead of exporting and importing the package from Git to new projects, its imported back to original project and now many files, applications , cds , https services are inconsistent and many are deleted.

Any possibility to retrieve it back. Like if we can export and import the whole package from QAS back to development system.

entry.title: Authorization In Sales Document Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

For sales process, person-based authorization is required in the system, documents in the system need to be segregated both at the organizational level and on a person-specific basis. For example, if there are five people responsible for region X, they should not be able to see each other‚Äôs sales orders. We already achieve this at the regional level using standard structures such as divisions. However, when it comes to person-based authorization, there is no relevant object available within the authorization catalogs. In the standard structure, there is no direct support for person-based authorization. 

We've tried access restriction in related sales business roles but neither VA01/VA02/VA03 nor Manage Sales Order business catalogs seem to contain restriction fields necessary to achieve this filteration. We also implemented BADIs SD_SLS_CHECK_HEAD and SD_SLS_CHECK_ITEM with the hopes of exiting the screen for unrestriced users when they display an unauthorized sales order, however these BADIs can only display error messages inside the document screen as displayed 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Local Currency change impact on Group reporting
entry.content:
We are planning to change the functional currency from local currency to Group currency USD for some of the consolidation units in the ledger Company code settings for local reporting decided by the management.

We need to understand its implication on the Group reporting consolidation unit currency settings which is same as functional currency and the data is transferred from Universal Journal.

Since the data transferred from universal journal is so far in GBP and the data in group reporting is already updated as GBP if we change the currency to USD in GR CU, we would like to understand how the transaction data in group reporting presently in local currency GBP will be converted to USD and how the balances LC is carried forward.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Alternative BOM as a component
entry.content:
I have to deal with inquiry from my client as below and I'm stuck with it. Please help me if you know.

Their finished product has multilevel BOM. Last level or any level can include a size-variable or configurable material. However they do not want to use Variant Configuration and I am trying to use alternative BOM for them.

For example:

1. Finished goods A, alternative BOM 1 has semi finished goods A1 and A2. 
Semi finished goods A1, alternative BOM 1 has raw material B1 and C1

2. Finished goods A, alternative BOM 2 has semi finished goods A1 and A2. 
Semi finished goods A1, alternative BOM 2 has raw material B2 and C1

My problem is, the last layer BOM (A1 in above example) has multiple BOM alternatives, but the next layer does not pickup no alternative other than alternative 1.

Please help me how to set up.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Custom Tax Condition Type SAP Public Cloud Customer Project Plan
entry.content:
Dear All i want to ask about custom condition type for app customer project plan in sap public cloud

in the SO the custom condition type already can be found 

but when i create billing the condition type can't be found

the configuration is still standard , i only add another condition type into the pricing procedure

is there some missing with the configuration or is it different between SO and Billing when we talk about Customer Project Plan ?

 

 

Thankyou

entry.title: How to Create Data via BOI from Custom SAPUI5 App in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm working on an SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud scenario where I need to create new data (entity instances) from a custom SAPUI5 application.
The app is already deployed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad and is consuming an OData service that I exposed through ABAP Development Tools (ADT) in Eclipse. This OData service is based on a custom CDS view.

Now, I want to perform create operations ‚Äî for example, creating a Production Order Confirmation.
I found the following Business Object Interface (BOI) on the SAP API Business Hub:
üëâ I_PRODUCTIONORDCONFIRMATIONTP

However, I‚Äôm not sure about the best practice for implementing this BOI interface in the Public Cloud environment:

  • Should I create a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) behavior definition that consumes the BOI interface?

  • Or is there another recommended integration pattern for invoking BOIs from a custom application?

  • How can I trigger the BOI create operation from my custom UI5 app (which currently consumes only my custom CDS service)?

I‚Äôd appreciate any guidance, examples, or references on how to correctly implement a BOI-based data creation scenario in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Thank you in advance!
Tadeas

entry.title: Linking Custom CDS View to Custom Field in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I‚Äôve created a Custom CDS View with the scenario set as ‚ÄúExternal API,‚Äù which is based on the I_BankAccountDEX data source to retrieve bank account entries.

Separately, I‚Äôve defined a Custom Field using the Bank Account Master Data (I_BANKACCOUNTTP) business context via the Custom Fields Fiori app.

However, I‚Äôm unable to see this Custom CDS View listed in the Custom Field configuration, which prevents me from linking the two. Is there a way to associate this Custom CDS View with the Custom Field or vice versa so that the field can be accessed through the CDS View API and integrated with the existing business objects?

Looking forward to your guidance.

entry.title: Manage multiple add on fields under one sales order items
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We would like to seek for your advice how to proceed with development.

In Manage Sales Order version 2 app, there is a requirement whereby in one sales order item, it is required to maintain lot no.1, lot qty.1, lot no.2, lot qty.3.... and etc. up to lot no.30.

For example:

Item 10: Product A = 1000kg

Lot no.1: A0001= 300kg

Lot no.2: A0002 = 500kg

Lot no.3: A0003 = 700kg

Lot no.4:A0004 = 500kg

total of lot qty will be equal to sales order line item qty

Ideally, we would like to create a table under Sales Order line item to create 1 to many relationship.

However, it seems not feasible.

Could we get advice how to proceed as we would like to avoid too many add-on fields in the Sales Order app?

Thank You.

Regards,

Chin Yee

entry.title: Report related to stock retained period.
entry.content:
Dear Commnity,
I'm in charge of preparing SAP Public Cloud project.

I want to check the how long has it been since we post goods receipt for material batch.
I'm able to check the final goods receipt date related to batch.
But I want to see the automatically calculate dates after goods receipt.
For example) I posted goods receipts for Material A and Batch 1 2025/11/01 and In the report side, I want to see the date 10 for Material A and Batch1

Is there any standard report function in the SAP Public cloud?

Kindly advise,
Best Regards
